org.sbrubbles.conditio

Interface Restart

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Function<Restart.Option,Object>, Predicate<Restart.Option>

    public interface Restart
extends Predicate<Restart.Option>, Function<Restart.Option,Object>
    Provides a recovery strategy for conditions. It takes a restart option, which typically also holds useful data for the recovery, and computes a result.

    Similarly to a handler, a restart can do two things:

    • check if it accepts a given restart option (with Predicate.test(Object)); and
    • analyze said option, producing the end result (with Function.apply(Object)).

    Since a restart works both as a predicate and as a function, this interface extends both.

    See Also:
    Restart.Option

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Restart.Option
      Serves both as input for restarts, and a way to select which restart to use: the earliest-bound one in the stack which accepts it.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Predicate

        and, isEqual, negate, or, test

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, apply, compose, identity
